title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
We are looking for a passionate and motivated Junior Software Engineer to join our growing remote team. This role is ideal for fresh graduates or early\\-career professionals who want to build a strong foundation in software development while working on real\\-world projects.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





 Assist in designing, developing, testing, and maintaining software applications
 



 Write clean, efficient, and well\\-documented code
 



 Collaborate with senior developers and cross\\-functional teams
 



 Debug, troubleshoot, and resolve technical issues
 



 Participate in code reviews and team discussions
 



 Continuously learn new technologies and improve technical skills
 



  





**Required Skills \\& Qualifications** 




  





 Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field (or equivalent practical experience)
 



 Basic knowledge of at least one programming language (Java / Python / JavaScript / C\\+\\+ or similar)
 



 Understanding of OOP concepts and data structures
 



 Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and basic web concepts is a plus
 



 Basic knowledge of databases (MySQL / PostgreSQL or similar)
 



 Willingness to learn, adapt, and grow in a fast\\-paced environment
 



  





**Nice to Have** 




  





 Knowledge of Git or any version control system
 



 Basic understanding of frameworks or libraries
 



 Internship or project experience (academic or personal)
 



  





**What We Offer** 




  





 100% Remote work opportunity
 



 Mentorship from experienced developers
 



 Learning and growth\\-focused environment
 



 Opportunity to work on live projects
 



 Career growth based on performance

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Software Engineer, Platform (On\\-site Bangalore)** 




  





 We just kicked off a search for a Platform Engineer to join a small, high\\-commitment team building the backend infrastructure powering a fast\\-growing compliance automation platform. This is a rare opportunity to own core systems end to end, ship quickly, and work in an environment where impact is immediate and the bar is extremely high.
 



  





**Why this role matters** 




  





 The team is indexing the world‚Äôs regulations and building systems that let global enterprises query them efficiently. The work spans distributed systems, high\\-scale backend engineering, and reliability\\-focused infrastructure. You will go from idea to production in days, not months, and everything you build directly affects real customers.
 



  





**What you‚Äôll do** 




  





 You will own backend development in Golang and Node.js, build foundational services across the product suite, improve uptime and latency, and write clean, maintainable systems that handle complex business logic at scale. You will think like an SRE, ship like an early engineer, and understand exactly how your work impacts customers.
 



  





**What they‚Äôre looking for** 




  





 Engineers with three to five years of backend experience who take pride in their craft, enjoy hard technical problems, understand the weight of customer impact, and are comfortable in a culture built on meritocracy, intensity, and ownership. This team moves fast, holds a very high bar, and rewards exceptional work.
 



  





 This is a fully on\\-site role in Koramangala, Bangalore. If you want to join a small team going head to head with some of the largest firms in the world and build mission\\-critical systems from day one, I‚Äôd be happy to share more.

title: Senior Nodejs full stack developer
description:
**About us:** 




 Zemoso Technologies is a Software Product Market Fit Studio that brings silicon valley style rapid prototyping and rapid application builds to Entrepreneurs and Corporate innovation. We offer Innovation as a service and work on ideas from scratch and take it to the Product Market Fit stage using Design Thinking\\-\\>Lean Execution\\-\\>Agile Methodology.
 



 We were featured as one of Deloitte Fastest 50 growing tech companies from India thrice (2016, 2018 and 2019\\). We were also featured in Deloitte Technology Fast 500 Asia Pacific both in 2016 and 2018\\.
 



 We are located in Hyderabad, India, and Dallas, US. We have recently incorporated another office in Waterloo, Canada.
 



 Our founders have had past successes \\- founded a decision management company acquired by SAP AG (now part of Hana Big data stack \\& NetWeaver BPM), early engineering team of Zoho (leading billion $ SaaS player) \\& some Private Equity experience.
 



 Marquee customers along with some exciting start\\-ups are part of our clientele.
 



**What You will do**

 ‚óè Work on software products designed from scratch using the latest cutting edge technologies, platforms and languages such as NodeJs, Javascript..
 



 ‚óè Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non\\-hierarchical culture.

**Basic Qualifications**

**Nice to have Qualifications**

**Benefits**

title: Cloud AWS DevSecOps engineer
description:
**Company Description** 




 FlexibleIR specializes in equipping organizations with robust cyber\\-attack preparedness through advanced incident response solutions. At the core of our approach are state\\-of\\-the\\-art, visually simple playbooks that help cyber defenders develop the "muscle memory" required to effectively handle sophisticated threats. We provide an extensive library of strategic and tactical playbooks, customizable to meet varying on\\-premise and cloud\\-based threat scenarios. By utilizing familiar tools like Trello, Slack, and Google Sheets, we ensure a seamless transformation without introducing the burden of learning new software. FlexibleIR empowers clients to respond to challenges such as ransomware and stringent regulations with confidence and precision.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 This is a full\\-time, on\\-site role based in Bengaluru for a Cloud AWS DevSecOps Engineer. The role involves designing, implementing, and maintaining cloud infrastructure with a focus on security. You will collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to ensure the secure deployment and maintenance of cloud systems, automate processes for efficiency, and contribute to incident response readiness. Additionally, you will be responsible for integrating security best practices into the development lifecycle and managing infrastructure in line with organizational requirements.
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Good startup experience in setting up, deployment and scaling applications on AWS or any other cloud providers. Basic EC2, MongoDB, MySQL, NGINX.
* Comfortable on RedHat and CIS hardening methodologies
* Strong experience in Software Development and understanding of DevSecOps principles
* Proficiency in managing and optimizing Infrastructure and Cloud Computing environments, specifically AWS or similar platforms
* Expertise in Redhat Linux and a solid understanding of system administration
* Experience working with Databases and ensuring data security in cloud\\-based systems
* Ability to collaborate across teams to embed security practices in the CI/CD pipeline
* Knowledge of cybersecurity and incident response processes is a plus
* Strong problem\\-solving skills with the ability to work in a fast\\-paced environment
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field is preferred

title: Azure Data Engineer (Standard)
description:
**Roles \\& Responsibilities**
**Core Skills**
**Key Responsibilities**
* Data Quality Development \\& Monitoring
* Design and implement automated data quality rules and validation checks using Databricks (Delta Lake) and PySpark.
* Build and operationalize data quality workflows in Ataccama ONE / Ataccama Studio.
* Perform data profiling, anomaly detection, and reconciliation across systems and data sources.
* Establish thresholds, KPIs, and alerts for data quality metrics.
* Root Cause Analysis \\& Issue Management
* Investigate data anomalies and quality incidents using SQL, Python, and Ataccama diagnostics.
* Collaborate with data engineers and business analysts to identify and remediate root causes.
* Document recurring data issues and contribute to preventive automation solutions.
* Collaboration \\& Governance Support
* Partner with data stewards, governance, and analytics teams to define and maintain DQ rules and SLAs.
* Contribute to metadata enrichment, lineage documentation, and data catalog integration.
* Support adoption of DQ frameworks and promote data reliability best practices.
* Automation \\& Continuous Improvement
* Integrate DQ validations into orchestration tools (Airflow, Databricks Workflows, or ADF).
* Leverage Python/Pyspark libraries to complement existing platforms.
* Propose process improvements to enhance automation, monitoring, and exception management.


**Core Technical Skills**
**Category**
**Tools / Skills**
**Data Engineering \\& Quality**
 Databricks (Delta Lake), PySpark, SQL, Python
   

  

**DQ Platforms**
 Ataccama ONE / Studio (DQ rules, workflows, profiling)
   

  

**Orchestration**
 Apache Airflow, Azure Data Factory, or Databricks Jobs
   

  

**Data Warehouses**
 Databricks Lakehouse
   

  

**Version Control / CI\\-CD**
 Git, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps
   

  

**Data Catalog / Lineage (Optional)**
 Collibra, Alation, Ataccama Catalog
   

  

**Cloud Environments**
 Azure (preferred), AWS, or GCP
   

  

**Qualifications \\& Experience**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics, or related field.
* 6‚Äì9 years of experience in data quality, data engineering, or analytics operations.
* Strong command of SQL, Python, and PySpark for data validation and troubleshooting.
* Proven experience with Ataccama DQ rule creation and monitoring.
* Hands\\-on exposure to Databricks for building and running data pipelines.
* Working knowledge of reconciliation processes, data profiling, and DQ metrics.


**Soft Skills \\& Attributes**
* Analytical thinker with strong problem\\-solving abilities.
* Detail\\-oriented and methodical approach to troubleshooting.
* Strong communication skills for cross\\-functional collaboration.
* Proactive mindset, capable of owning issues through resolution.
* Comfortable balancing hands\\-on technical work with business stakeholder interaction.


**Preferred / Nice To Have**
* Exposure to data governance frameworks or MDM initiatives.
* Familiarity with observability tools (Grafana, Datadog, Prometheus).
* Understanding of CI/CD practices for data quality deployment.
* Certification in Databricks, Ataccama, or a major cloud platform (Azure/AWS).


**Success Indicators**
* Increase in automated data quality coverage across critical datasets.
* Reduction in recurring manual DQ exceptions.
* Improved timeliness and accuracy of data available for analytics.
* Positive stakeholder feedback on data trust and reliability.


**Experience**
* 4\\.5\\-6 Years


**Skills**
* Primary Skill: Data Engineering
* Sub Skill(s): Data Engineering
* Additional Skill(s): Python, Databricks, SQL, Azure Data Factory

We accelerate experience\\-led transformation in the delivery of digital platforms. Infogain is also a Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) Gold Partner and Azure Expert Managed Services Provider (MSP).
   

  

 Infogain, an Apax Funds portfolio company, has offices in California, Washington, Texas, the UK, the UAE, and Singapore, with delivery centers in Seattle, Houston, Austin, Krak√≥w, Noida, Gurgaon, Mumbai, Pune, and Bengaluru.

**About The Team**
 eClerx is a global leader in productized services, bringing together people, technology and domain expertise to amplify business results. Our mission is to set the benchmark for client service and success in our industry. Our vision is to be the innovation partner of choice for technology, data analytics and process management services. Since our inception in 2000, we've partnered with top companies across various industries, including financial services, telecommunications, retail, and high\\-tech. Our innovative solutions and domain expertise help businesses optimize operations, improve efficiency, and drive growth. With over 18,000 employees worldwide, eClerx is dedicated to delivering excellence through smart automation and data\\-driven insights. At eClerx, we believe in nurturing talent and providing hands\\-on experience.
   

  

 eClerx is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, per applicable law.
